attributes.action: Prevent companies exploiting phone calls made by complainants to call centres etc
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call on the Prime Minister to prevent organisations having the automatic right to use consumers’ telephone calls to call centres etc for training purposes. 
We believe it is wrong that without an individual giving permission, a phone call can be freely analysed and exploited in a way that could make it more difficult for future complainants. We therefore ask the Prime Minister to introduce a system whereby such phone calls remain private unless consumers opt-in to allow the organisation to make use of them. 
We nevertheless recognise that it is useful for security purposes that phone calls are recorded; however, they should only be accessed if there is a security issue.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
